an4.8:1.1.pli: “Cattārimāni, bhikkhave, tathāgatassa vesārajjāni, yehi vesārajjehi samannāgato tathāgato āsabhaṃ ṭhānaṃ paṭijānāti, parisāsu sīhanādaṃ nadati, brahmacakkaṃ pavatteti.
an4.8:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a Realized One has four kinds of self-assurance. With these he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the divine wheel.

an4.8:1.3.pli: ‘“Sammāsambuddhassa te paṭijānato ime dhammā anabhisambuddhā”ti tatra vata maṃ samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā devo vā māro vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmiṃ sahadhammena paṭicodessatī’ti nimittametaṃ, bhikkhave, na samanupassāmi.
an4.8:1.3.eng: I see no reason for anyone—whether ascetic, brahmin, god, Māra, or the Divinity, or anyone else in the world—to legitimately scold me, saying: ‘You claim to be a fully awakened Buddha, but you don’t understand these things.’

an4.8:1.4.pli: Etamahaṃ, bhikkhave, nimittaṃ asamanupassanto khemappatto abhayappatto vesārajjappatto viharāmi.
an4.8:1.4.eng: Since I see no such reason, I live secure, fearless, and assured.

an4.8:2.1.pli: ‘“Khīṇāsavassa te paṭijānato ime āsavā aparikkhīṇā”ti tatra vata maṃ samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā devo vā māro vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmiṃ sahadhammena paṭicodessatī’ti nimittametaṃ, bhikkhave, na samanupassāmi.
an4.8:2.1.eng: I see no reason for anyone—whether ascetic, brahmin, god, Māra, or the Divinity, or anyone else in the world—to legitimately scold me, saying: ‘You claim to have ended all defilements, but you still have these defilements.’

an4.8:2.2.pli: Etamahaṃ, bhikkhave, nimittaṃ asamanupassanto khemappatto abhayappatto vesārajjappatto viharāmi.
an4.8:2.2.eng: Since I see no such reason, I live secure, fearless, and assured.

an4.8:3.1.pli: ‘“Ye kho pana te antarāyikā dhammā vuttā te paṭisevato nālaṃ antarāyāyā”ti tatra vata maṃ samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā devo vā māro vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmiṃ sahadhammena paṭicodessatī’ti nimittametaṃ, bhikkhave, na samanupassāmi.
an4.8:3.1.eng: I see no reason for anyone—whether ascetic, brahmin, god, Māra, or the Divinity, or anyone else in the world—to legitimately scold me, saying: ‘The acts that you say are obstructions are not really obstructions for the one who performs them.’

an4.8:3.2.pli: Etamahaṃ, bhikkhave, nimittaṃ asamanupassanto khemappatto abhayappatto vesārajjappatto viharāmi.
an4.8:3.2.eng: Since I see no such reason, I live secure, fearless, and assured.

an4.8:4.1.pli: ‘“Yassa kho pana te atthāya dhammo desito so na niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāyā”ti tatra vata maṃ samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā devo vā māro vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmiṃ sahadhammena paṭicodessatī’ti nimittametaṃ, bhikkhave, na samanupassāmi.
an4.8:4.1.eng: I see no reason for anyone—whether ascetic, brahmin, god, Māra, or the Divinity, or anyone else in the world—to legitimately scold me, saying: ‘Though you teach that this teaching leads to the goal of the complete ending of suffering, it doesn’t lead there for one who practices it.’

an4.8:4.2.pli: Etamahaṃ, bhikkhave, nimittaṃ asamanupassanto khemappatto abhayappatto vesārajjappatto viharāmi.
an4.8:4.2.eng: Since I see no such reason, I live secure, fearless, and assured.

an4.8:4.3.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, cattāri tathāgatassa vesārajjāni, yehi vesārajjehi samannāgato tathāgato āsabhaṃ ṭhānaṃ paṭijānāti, parisāsu sīhanādaṃ nadati, brahmacakkaṃ pavattetīti.
an4.8:4.3.eng: A Realized One possesses these four kinds of self-assurance. With these he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the divine wheel.

an4.8:5.3.eng: vanish on reaching a Realized One,

an4.8:5.4.eng: assured, gone beyond grounds for criticism.

an4.8:6.1.eng: He rolls forth the Wheel of Dhamma <j>as a consummate one,

an4.8:6.2.eng: complete, sympathetic for all living creatures.

an4.8:6.3.eng: Sentient beings revere him, <j>first among gods and humans,

an4.80:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
an4.80:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kosambī, in Ghosita’s Monastery.

an4.80:1.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an4.80:1.2.eng: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

an4.80:2.1.pli: “Ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo, yena mātugāmo neva sabhāyaṃ nisīdati, na kammantaṃ payojeti, na kambojaṃ gacchatī”ti?
an4.80:2.1.eng: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why ladies don’t attend council meetings, work for a living, or travel to Persia?”

an4.80:2.6.pli: ayaṃ kho, ānanda, hetu ayaṃ paccayo, yena mātugāmo neva sabhāyaṃ nisīdati, na kammantaṃ payojeti, na kambojaṃ gacchatī”ti.
an4.80:2.6.eng: This is the cause, this is the reason why ladies don’t attend council meetings, work for a living, or travel to Persia.”

an4.81:1.1.pli: “Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an4.81:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, someone with four qualities is cast down to hell.

an4.81:1.3.pli: Pāṇātipātī hoti, adinnādāyī hoti, kāmesumicchācārī hoti, musāvādī hoti—
an4.81:1.3.eng: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, and lie.

an4.81:1.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an4.81:1.4.eng: Someone with these four qualities is cast down to hell.

an4.81:2.1.pli: Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
an4.81:2.1.eng: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven.

an4.81:2.3.pli: Pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato hoti—
an4.81:2.3.eng: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, or lie.

an4.81:2.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
an4.81:2.4.eng: Someone with these four qualities is raised up to heaven.”

an4.82:1.1.pli: “Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an4.82:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, someone with four qualities is cast down to hell.

an4.82:1.3.pli: Musāvādī hoti, pisuṇavāco hoti, pharusavāco hoti, samphappalāpī hoti—
an4.82:1.3.eng: They use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical.

an4.82:1.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an4.82:1.4.eng: Someone with these four qualities is cast down to hell.

an4.82:2.1.pli: Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
an4.82:2.1.eng: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven.

an4.82:2.3.pli: Musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti—
an4.82:2.3.eng: They don’t use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical.

an4.82:2.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
an4.82:2.4.eng: Someone with these four qualities is raised up to heaven.”

an4.83:1.1.pli: “Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an4.83:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, someone with four qualities is cast down to hell.

an4.83:1.3.eng: Without examining or scrutinizing, they praise those deserving of criticism,

an4.83:1.4.eng: and they criticize those deserving of praise.

an4.83:1.5.pli: ananuvicca apariyogāhetvā appasādanīye ṭhāne pasādaṃ upadaṃseti, ananuvicca apariyogāhetvā pasādanīye ṭhāne appasādaṃ upadaṃseti—
an4.83:1.5.eng: They arouse faith in things that are dubious, and they don’t arouse faith in things that are inspiring.

an4.83:1.6.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an4.83:1.6.eng: Someone with these four qualities is cast down to hell.

an4.83:2.1.pli: Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
an4.83:2.1.eng: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven.

an4.83:2.3.eng: After examining and scrutinizing, they criticize those deserving of criticism,

an4.83:2.4.eng: and they praise those deserving of praise.

an4.83:2.5.pli: anuvicca pariyogāhetvā appasādanīye ṭhāne appasādaṃ upadaṃseti
an4.83:2.5.eng: They don’t arouse faith in things that are dubious,

an4.83:2.6.pli: anuvicca pariyogāhetvā pasādanīye ṭhāne pasādaṃ upadaṃseti—
an4.83:2.6.eng: and they do arouse faith in things that are inspiring.

an4.83:2.7.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
an4.83:2.7.eng: Someone with these four qualities is raised up to heaven.”

an4.84:1.1.pli: “Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an4.84:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, someone with four qualities is cast down to hell.

an4.84:1.3.pli: Kodhagaru hoti na saddhammagaru, makkhagaru hoti na saddhammagaru, lābhagaru hoti na saddhammagaru, sakkāragaru hoti na saddhammagaru—
an4.84:1.3.eng: They value anger, or denigration, or material things, or honor rather than the true teaching.

an4.84:1.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an4.84:1.4.eng: Someone with these four qualities is cast down to hell.

an4.84:2.1.pli: Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
an4.84:2.1.eng: Someone with four qualities is raised up to heaven.

an4.84:2.3.pli: Saddhammagaru hoti na kodhagaru, saddhammagaru hoti na makkhagaru, saddhammagaru hoti na lābhagaru, saddhammagaru hoti na sakkāragaru—
an4.84:2.3.eng: They value the true teaching rather than anger, or denigration, or material things, or honor.

an4.84:2.4.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
an4.84:2.4.eng: Someone with these four qualities is raised up to heaven.”

an4.85:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.85:1.5.eng: the light bound for darkness, and

an4.85:2.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo tamo hoti tamaparāyaṇo?
an4.85:2.1.eng: And how is an individual dark and bound for darkness?

an4.85:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo nīce kule paccājāto hoti—caṇḍālakule vā venakule vā nesādakule vā rathakārakule vā pukkusakule vā dalidde appannapānabhojane kasiravuttike, yattha kasirena ghāsacchādo labbhati.
an4.85:2.2.eng: It’s when an individual is reborn in a low family—a family of corpse-workers, bamboo-workers, hunters, chariot-makers, or scavengers—poor, with little to eat or drink, where life is tough, and food and shelter are hard to find.

an4.85:2.3.pli: So ca hoti dubbaṇṇo duddasiko okoṭimako bavhābādho kāṇo vā kuṇī vā khañjo vā pakkhahato vā, na lābhī annassa pānassa vatthassa yānassa mālāgandhavilepanassa seyyāvasathapadīpeyyassa.
an4.85:2.3.eng: And they’re ugly, unsightly, deformed, sickly—one-eyed, crippled, lame, or half-paralyzed. They don’t get to have food, drink, clothes, and vehicles; garlands, fragrance, and makeup; or bed, house, and lighting.

an4.85:2.4.pli: So kāyena duccaritaṃ carati, vācāya duccaritaṃ carati, manasā duccaritaṃ carati.
an4.85:2.4.eng: And they do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.

an4.85:2.5.pli: So kāyena duccaritaṃ caritvā, vācāya duccaritaṃ caritvā, manasā duccaritaṃ caritvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati.
an4.85:2.5.eng: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

an4.85:2.6.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo tamo hoti tamaparāyaṇo.
an4.85:2.6.eng: That’s how an individual is dark and bound for darkness.

an4.85:3.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo tamo hoti jotiparāyaṇo?
an4.85:3.1.eng: And how is an individual dark and bound for light?

an4.85:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo nīce kule paccājāto hoti—caṇḍālakule vā venakule vā nesādakule vā rathakārakule vā pukkusakule vā dalidde appannapānabhojane kasiravuttike, yattha kasirena ghāsacchādo labbhati;
an4.85:3.2.eng: It’s when an individual is reborn in a low family …

an4.85:3.3.pli: so ca hoti dubbaṇṇo duddasiko okoṭimako bavhābādho kāṇo vā kuṇī vā khañjo vā pakkhahato vā na lābhī annassa pānassa vatthassa yānassa mālāgandhavilepanassa seyyāvasathapadīpeyyassa.

an4.85:3.4.pli: So kāyena sucaritaṃ carati, vācāya sucaritaṃ carati, manasā sucaritaṃ carati.
an4.85:3.4.eng: But they do good things by way of body, speech, and mind.

an4.85:3.5.pli: So kāyena sucaritaṃ caritvā, vācāya sucaritaṃ caritvā, manasā sucaritaṃ caritvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati.
an4.85:3.5.eng: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

an4.85:3.6.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo tamo hoti jotiparāyaṇo.
an4.85:3.6.eng: That’s how an individual is dark and bound for light.

an4.85:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo joti hoti tamaparāyaṇo?
an4.85:4.1.eng: And how is an individual light and bound for darkness?

an4.85:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ucce kule paccājāto hoti—khattiyamahāsālakule vā brāhmaṇamahāsālakule vā gahapatimahāsālakule vā aḍḍhe mahaddhane mahābhoge pahūtajātarūparajate pahūtavittūpakaraṇe pahūtadhanadhaññe;
an4.85:4.2.eng: It’s when an individual is reborn in an eminent family—a well-to-do family of aristocrats, brahmins, or householders—rich, affluent, and wealthy, with lots of gold and silver, lots of property and assets, and lots of money and grain.

an4.85:4.3.pli: so ca hoti abhirūpo dassanīyo pāsādiko paramāya vaṇṇapokkharatāya samannāgato, lābhī annassa pānassa vatthassa yānassa mālāgandhavilepanassa seyyāvasathapadīpeyyassa.
an4.85:4.3.eng: And they’re attractive, good-looking, lovely, of surpassing beauty. They get to have food, drink, clothes, and vehicles; garlands, fragrance, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.

an4.85:4.4.pli: So kāyena duccaritaṃ carati, vācāya duccaritaṃ carati, manasā duccaritaṃ carati.
an4.85:4.4.eng: But they do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.

an4.85:4.5.pli: So kāyena duccaritaṃ caritvā, vācāya duccaritaṃ caritvā, manasā duccaritaṃ caritvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati.
an4.85:4.5.eng: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

an4.85:4.6.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo joti hoti tamaparāyaṇo.
an4.85:4.6.eng: That’s how an individual is light and bound for darkness.

an4.85:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo joti hoti jotiparāyaṇo?
an4.85:5.1.eng: And how is an individual light and bound for light?

an4.85:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ucce kule paccājāto hoti—khattiyamahāsālakule vā brāhmaṇamahāsālakule vā gahapatimahāsālakule vā aḍḍhe mahaddhane mahābhoge pahūtajātarūparajate pahūtavittūpakaraṇe pahūtadhanadhaññe;
an4.85:5.2.eng: It’s when an individual is reborn in an eminent family …

an4.85:5.3.pli: so ca hoti abhirūpo dassanīyo pāsādiko paramāya vaṇṇapokkharatāya samannāgato, lābhī annassa pānassa vatthassa yānassa mālāgandhavilepanassa seyyāvasathapadīpeyyassa.

an4.85:5.4.pli: So kāyena sucaritaṃ carati, vācāya sucaritaṃ carati, manasā sucaritaṃ carati.
an4.85:5.4.eng: And they do good things by way of body, speech, and mind.

an4.85:5.5.pli: So kāyena sucaritaṃ caritvā, vācāya sucaritaṃ caritvā, manasā sucaritaṃ caritvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati.
an4.85:5.5.eng: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

an4.85:5.6.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo joti hoti jotiparāyaṇo.
an4.85:5.6.eng: That’s how an individual is light and bound for light.

an4.85:5.7.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.85:5.7.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.86:1.1.eng: “These four individuals are found in the world.

an4.86:1.3.eng: One sunk low who sinks lower,

an4.86:1.4.eng: one sunk low who rises high,

an4.86:1.5.eng: one risen high who sinks low, and

an4.86:1.6.eng: one risen high who rises higher.

an4.86:1.7.pli: … Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.86:1.7.eng: … These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.87:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.87:1.3.eng: The confirmed ascetic, the white lotus ascetic, the pink lotus ascetic, and the delicate ascetic of ascetics.

an4.87:2.1.eng: And how is an individual a confirmed ascetic?

an4.87:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sekho hoti pāṭipado;
an4.87:2.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant is a practicing trainee,

an4.87:2.3.eng: who lives aspiring to the supreme sanctuary from the yoke.

an4.87:2.4.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, rañño khattiyassa muddhāvasittassa jeṭṭho putto ābhiseko anabhisitto macalappatto;
an4.87:2.4.eng: It’s like the eldest son of an anointed aristocratic king. He has not yet been anointed, but is eligible, and has been confirmed in the succession.

an4.87:2.5.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sekho hoti pāṭipado, anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ patthayamāno viharati.
an4.87:2.5.eng: In the same way, a mendicant is a practicing trainee, who lives aspiring to the supreme sanctuary from the yoke.

an4.87:2.6.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇamacalo hoti.
an4.87:2.6.eng: That’s how an individual is a confirmed ascetic.

an4.87:3.1.eng: And how is an individual a white lotus ascetic?

an4.87:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati, no ca kho aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati.
an4.87:3.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements. But they don’t have direct meditative experience of the eight liberations.

an4.87:3.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇapuṇḍarīko hoti.
an4.87:3.3.eng: That’s how an individual is a white lotus ascetic.

an4.87:4.1.eng: And how is an individual a pink lotus ascetic?

an4.87:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati, aṭṭha ca vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati.
an4.87:4.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. … And they have direct meditative experience of the eight liberations.

an4.87:4.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇapadumo hoti.
an4.87:4.3.eng: That’s how an individual is a pink lotus ascetic.

an4.87:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇesu samaṇasukhumālo hoti?
an4.87:5.1.eng: And how is an individual a delicate ascetic of ascetics?

an4.87:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yācitova bahulaṃ cīvaraṃ paribhuñjati, appaṃ ayācito; yācitova bahulaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ paribhuñjati, appaṃ ayācito; yācitova bahulaṃ senāsanaṃ paribhuñjati, appaṃ ayācito; yācitova bahulaṃ gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṃ paribhuñjati, appaṃ ayācito.
an4.87:5.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant usually uses only what they’ve been invited to accept—robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick—rarely using them without invitation.

an4.87:5.3.pli: Yehi kho pana sabrahmacārīhi saddhiṃ viharati, tyassa manāpeneva bahulaṃ kāyakammena samudācaranti, appaṃ amanāpena; manāpeneva bahulaṃ vacīkammena samudācaranti, appaṃ amanāpena; manāpeneva bahulaṃ manokammena samudācaranti, appaṃ amanāpena;
an4.87:5.3.eng: When living with other spiritual practitioners, they usually find themselves treated agreeably by them by way of body, speech, and mind, and rarely disagreeably.

an4.87:5.4.pli: manāpaṃyeva bahulaṃ upahāraṃ upaharanti, appaṃ amanāpaṃ.
an4.87:5.4.eng: And they are usually presented with agreeable things by them, rarely with disagreeable ones.

an4.87:5.5.pli: Yāni kho pana tāni vedayitāni pittasamuṭṭhānāni vā semhasamuṭṭhānāni vā vātasamuṭṭhānāni vā sannipātikāni vā utupariṇāmajāni vā visamaparihārajāni vā opakkamikāni vā kammavipākajāni vā, tāni panassa na bahudeva uppajjanti. Appābādho hoti.
an4.87:5.5.eng: They’re healthy, so the various unpleasant feelings—stemming from disorders of bile, phlegm, wind, or their conjunction; or caused by change in weather, by not taking care of yourself, by overexertion, or as the result of past deeds—usually don’t come up.

an4.87:5.6.pli: Catunnaṃ jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī,
an4.87:5.6.eng: They get the four absorptions—blissful meditations in this life that belong to the higher mind—when they want, without trouble or difficulty.

an4.87:5.7.pli: āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
an4.87:5.7.eng: And they realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. …

an4.87:5.8.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇesu samaṇasukhumālo hoti.
an4.87:5.8.eng: That’s how an individual is a delicate ascetic of ascetics.

an4.87:6.1.pli: Yañhi taṃ, bhikkhave, sammā vadamāno vadeyya samaṇesu samaṇasukhumāloti, mameva taṃ, bhikkhave, sammā vadamāno vadeyya samaṇesu samaṇasukhumāloti.
an4.87:6.1.eng: And if anyone should be rightly called a delicate ascetic of ascetics, it’s me.

an4.87:6.2.pli: Ahañhi, bhikkhave, yācitova bahulaṃ cīvaraṃ paribhuñjāmi, appaṃ ayācito; yācitova bahulaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ paribhuñjāmi, appaṃ ayācito; yācitova bahulaṃ senāsanaṃ paribhuñjāmi, appaṃ ayācito; yācitova bahulaṃ gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṃ paribhuñjāmi, appaṃ ayācito.
an4.87:6.2.eng: For I usually use only what I’ve been invited to accept …

an4.87:6.3.pli: Yehi kho pana bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ viharāmi te me manāpeneva bahulaṃ kāyakammena samudācaranti, appaṃ amanāpena; manāpeneva bahulaṃ vacīkammena samudācaranti, appaṃ amanāpena; manāpeneva bahulaṃ manokammena samudācaranti, appaṃ amanāpena; manāpaṃyeva bahulaṃ upahāraṃ upaharanti, appaṃ amanāpaṃ.
an4.87:6.3.eng: When living with other mendicants, I am usually treated agreeably by them.  …

an4.87:6.4.pli: Yāni kho pana tāni vedayitāni pittasamuṭṭhānāni vā semhasamuṭṭhānāni vā vātasamuṭṭhānāni vā sannipātikāni vā utupariṇāmajāni vā visamaparihārajāni vā opakkamikāni vā kammavipākajāni vā, tāni me na bahudeva uppajjanti. Appābādhohamasmi.

an4.87:6.5.pli: Catunnaṃ kho panasmi jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī,
an4.87:6.5.eng: I get the four absorptions when I want, without trouble or difficulty.

an4.87:6.6.pli: āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharāmi.
an4.87:6.6.eng: And I’ve realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. …

an4.87:7.1.pli: Yañhi taṃ, bhikkhave, sammā vadamāno vadeyya samaṇesu samaṇasukhumāloti, mameva taṃ, bhikkhave, sammā vadamāno vadeyya samaṇesu samaṇasukhumāloti.
an4.87:7.1.eng: So if anyone should be rightly called a delicate ascetic of ascetics, it’s me.

an4.87:7.2.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.87:7.2.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.88:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.88:1.3.eng: The confirmed ascetic, the white lotus ascetic, the pink lotus ascetic, and the delicate ascetic of ascetics.

an4.88:2.1.eng: And how is an individual a confirmed ascetic?

an4.88:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā sotāpanno hoti avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo.
an4.88:2.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant—with the ending of three fetters—is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, destined for awakening.

an4.88:2.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇamacalo hoti.
an4.88:2.3.eng: That’s how an individual is a confirmed ascetic.

an4.88:3.1.eng: And how is an individual a white lotus ascetic?

an4.88:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā, rāgadosamohānaṃ tanuttā sakadāgāmī hoti, sakideva imaṃ lokaṃ āgantvā dukkhassantaṃ karoti.
an4.88:3.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant—with the ending of three fetters, and the weakening of greed, hate, and delusion—is a once-returner. They come back to this world once only, then make an end of suffering.

an4.88:3.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇapuṇḍarīko hoti.
an4.88:3.3.eng: That’s how an individual is a white lotus ascetic.

an4.88:4.1.eng: And how is an individual a pink lotus ascetic?

an4.88:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
an4.88:4.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant—with the ending of the five lower fetters—is reborn spontaneously. They’re extinguished there, and are not liable to return from that world.

an4.88:4.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇapadumo hoti.
an4.88:4.3.eng: That’s how an individual is a pink lotus ascetic.

an4.88:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇesu samaṇasukhumālo hoti?
an4.88:5.1.eng: And how is an individual a delicate ascetic of ascetics?

an4.88:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
an4.88:5.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

an4.88:5.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇesu samaṇasukhumālo hoti.
an4.88:5.3.eng: That’s how an individual is a delicate ascetic of ascetics.

an4.88:5.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.88:5.4.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.89:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these four individuals are found in the world.

an4.89:1.3.eng: The confirmed ascetic, the white lotus ascetic, the pink lotus ascetic, and the delicate ascetic of ascetics.

an4.89:2.1.eng: And how is an individual a confirmed ascetic?

an4.89:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sammādiṭṭhiko hoti, sammāsaṅkappo hoti, sammāvāco hoti, sammākammanto hoti, sammāājīvo hoti, sammāvāyāmo hoti, sammāsati hoti, sammāsamādhi hoti.
an4.89:2.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant has right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

an4.89:2.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇamacalo hoti.
an4.89:2.3.eng: That’s how an individual is a confirmed ascetic.

an4.89:3.1.eng: And how is an individual a white lotus ascetic?

an4.89:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sammādiṭṭhiko hoti, sammāsaṅkappo hoti, sammāvāco hoti, sammākammanto hoti, sammāājīvo hoti, sammāvāyāmo hoti, sammāsati hoti, sammāsamādhi hoti, sammāñāṇī hoti, sammāvimutti hoti, no ca kho aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati.
an4.89:3.2.eng: It’s when they have right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom. But they don’t have direct meditative experience of the eight liberations.

an4.89:3.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇapuṇḍarīko hoti.
an4.89:3.3.eng: That’s how an individual is a white lotus ascetic.

an4.89:4.1.eng: And how is an individual a pink lotus ascetic?

an4.89:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sammādiṭṭhiko hoti …pe… sammāvimutti hoti, aṭṭha ca vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati.
an4.89:4.2.eng: It’s when they have right view … and right freedom. And they do have direct meditative experience of the eight liberations.

an4.89:4.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇapadumo hoti.
an4.89:4.3.eng: That’s how an individual is a pink lotus ascetic.

an4.89:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo samaṇesu samaṇasukhumālo hoti?
an4.89:5.1.eng: And how is an individual a delicate ascetic of ascetics?

an4.89:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yācitova bahulaṃ cīvaraṃ paribhuñjati, appaṃ ayācito …pe… yañhi taṃ, bhikkhave, sammā vadamāno vadeyya samaṇesu samaṇasukhumāloti, mameva taṃ, bhikkhave, sammā vadamāno vadeyya samaṇesu samaṇasukhumāloti.
an4.89:5.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant usually uses only what they’ve been invited to accept … And if anyone should be rightly called a delicate ascetic of ascetics, it’s me.

an4.89:5.3.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an4.89:5.3.eng: These are the four individuals found in the world.”

an4.9:1.1.pli: “Cattārome, bhikkhave, taṇhuppādā yattha bhikkhuno taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjati.
an4.9:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are four things that give rise to craving in a mendicant.

an4.9:1.3.pli: Cīvarahetu vā, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjati;

an4.9:1.4.pli: piṇḍapātahetu vā, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjati;

an4.9:1.5.pli: senāsanahetu vā, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjati;

an4.9:1.6.pli: itibhavābhavahetu vā, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjati.
an4.9:1.6.eng: or rebirth in this or that state.

an4.9:1.7.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro taṇhuppādā yattha bhikkhuno taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjatīti.
an4.9:1.7.eng: These are the four things that give rise to craving in a mendicant.

an4.9:2.2.eng: as they transmigrate on this long journey.

an4.9:2.3.eng: They go from this state to another,

an4.9:3.2.eng: that craving is the cause of suffering—

an4.9:3.3.eng: rid of craving, free of grasping,
